claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.

new_evidence.quote: because it is not subject to mutations to the A (H3 N2) glycosylation binding site that reduce the effectiveness of egg based vaccines.
new_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote supports the claim by explaining that recombinant technology avoids certain mutations that can limit the effectiveness of traditional (egg-based) vaccines, implying a broader and potentially more cross-protective immune response.
